title: 109_hr177
content: The "Santa Ana River Water Supply Enhancement Act of 2005" is also known as the Prado Basin Natural Treatment System Project under the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act. The Secretary, in cooperation with the Orange County Water District, will participate in planning, designing, and constructing natural treatment systems and wetlands for the Santa Ana River flows into the Prado Basin. The Federal share of the project cost will not exceed 25%, and funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for project operation and maintenance. $20,000,000 is authorized for this section, with a sunset clause 10 years after enactment. (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of sections in Public Law 102-575 is amended by inserting after section 1634. The Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act is amended to include a new section on Regional Brine Lines. The Secretary may assist in constructing regional brine lines in Southern California to manage salinity levels, with a federal share of up to 25% of the total project cost. Agreements and regulations may be established as needed. The Secretary may provide funds for regional brine line construction in Southern California, with a limit of 25% of the project cost or $40,000,000. Funds cannot be used for project operation or maintenance. This section expires 10 years after enactment. SEC. 1638. LOWER CHINO DAIRY AREA DESALINATION DEMONSTRATION AND RECLAMATION PROJECT. The Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act is further amended to include this project. The Secretary, in cooperation with various agencies, will participate in the Lower Chino Dairy Area desalination project. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25% or $50,000,000. Funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for project operation or maintenance. Appropriations are authorized as necessary. This section will expire at a certain point. The section will expire 10 years after enactment, with a conforming amendment to the table of sections. Lower Chino dairy area desalination demonstration and reclamation project. Ceiling increase on federal share of water reclamation project. Section 1631(d) of the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act is amended to increase the federal share of costs for the project authorized by section 1624 for fiscal years 2007 to 2015. The federal share of costs for the project authorized by section 1624 is increased to $47,158,953 for fiscal year 2015 and $51,874,849 for fiscal year 2016. The Center for Technological Advancement of Membrane Technology and Education is established. The Secretary of the Interior will establish a center at the Orange County Water District in California for the development of membrane technologies and public education on membrane produced water supplies. The center will be managed through contracts with the water district, and a plan will be jointly prepared to outline its goals and objectives. The Secretary of the Interior will establish a center at the Orange County Water District in California for membrane technology development and public education. $2,000,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2006 through 2011. The Secretary will provide Congress with annual reports on the center's status and accomplishments. This section will expire 10 years after enactment. Passed the House of Representatives on October 18, 2005.
